abstract: Identifiers for specific facial features, for use with coefficients describing the relative movements of those features.
overview:
## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/blendShapes] dictionary provided by an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor] object describes the facial expression of a detected face in terms of the movements of specific facial features. For each key in the dictionary, the corresponding value is a floating point number indicating the current position of that feature relative to its neutral configuration, ranging from `0.0` (neutral) to `1.0` (maximum movement).

ARKit provides many blend shape coefficients, resulting in a detailed model of a facial expression; however, you can use as many or as few of the coefficients as you desire to create a visual effect. For example, you might animate a simple cartoon character using only the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/jawOpen], [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/eyeBlinkLeft], and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/eyeBlinkRight] coefficients. A professional 3D artist could create a detailed character model rigged for realistic animation using a larger set, or the entire set, of coefficients.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation
crawled: 2025-12-02T18:52:42Z
---

# ARFaceAnchor.BlendShapeLocation

**Structure**

Identifiers for specific facial features, for use with coefficients describing the relative movements of those features.

## Declaration

```swift
struct BlendShapeLocation
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/blendShapes] dictionary provided by an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor] object describes the facial expression of a detected face in terms of the movements of specific facial features. For each key in the dictionary, the corresponding value is a floating point number indicating the current position of that feature relative to its neutral configuration, ranging from `0.0` (neutral) to `1.0` (maximum movement).

ARKit provides many blend shape coefficients, resulting in a detailed model of a facial expression; however, you can use as many or as few of the coefficients as you desire to create a visual effect. For example, you might animate a simple cartoon character using only the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/jawOpen], [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/eyeBlinkLeft], and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFaceAnchor/BlendShapeLocation/eyeBlinkRight] coefficients. A professional 3D artist could create a detailed character model rigged for realistic animation using a larger set, or the entire set, of coefficients.



## Left Eye

- **eyeBlinkLeft**: The coefficient describing closure of the eyelids over the left eye.
- **eyeLookDownLeft**: The coefficient describing movement of the left eyelids consistent with a downward gaze.
- **eyeLookInLeft**: The coefficient describing movement of the left eyelids consistent with a rightward gaze.
- **eyeLookOutLeft**: The coefficient describing movement of the left eyelids consistent with a leftward gaze.
- **eyeLookUpLeft**: The coefficient describing movement of the left eyelids consistent with an upward gaze.
- **eyeSquintLeft**: The coefficient describing contraction of the face around the left eye.
- **eyeWideLeft**: The coefficient describing a widening of the eyelids around the left eye.

## Right Eye

- **eyeBlinkRight**: The coefficient describing closure of the eyelids over the right eye.
- **eyeLookDownRight**: The coefficient describing movement of the right eyelids consistent with a downward gaze.
- **eyeLookInRight**: The coefficient describing movement of the right eyelids consistent with a leftward gaze.
- **eyeLookOutRight**: The coefficient describing movement of the right eyelids consistent with a rightward gaze.
- **eyeLookUpRight**: The coefficient describing movement of the right eyelids consistent with an upward gaze.
- **eyeSquintRight**: The coefficient describing contraction of the face around the right eye.
- **eyeWideRight**: The coefficient describing a widening of the eyelids around the right eye.

## Mouth and Jaw

- **jawForward**: The coefficient describing forward movement of the lower jaw.
- **jawLeft**: The coefficient describing leftward movement of the lower jaw.
- **jawRight**: The coefficient describing rightward movement of the lower jaw.
- **jawOpen**: The coefficient describing an opening of the lower jaw.
- **mouthClose**: The coefficient describing closure of the lips *independent of jaw position*.
- **mouthFunnel**: The coefficient describing contraction of both lips into an open shape.
- **mouthPucker**: The coefficient describing contraction and compression of both closed lips.
- **mouthLeft**: The coefficient describing leftward movement of both lips together.
- **mouthRight**: The coefficient describing rightward movement of both lips together.
- **mouthSmileLeft**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the left corner of the mouth.
- **mouthSmileRight**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the right corner of the mouth.
- **mouthFrownLeft**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the left corner of the mouth.
- **mouthFrownRight**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the right corner of the mouth.
- **mouthDimpleLeft**: The coefficient describing backward movement of the left corner of the mouth.
- **mouthDimpleRight**: The coefficient describing backward movement of the right corner of the mouth.
- **mouthStretchLeft**: The coefficient describing leftward movement of the left corner of the mouth.
- **mouthStretchRight**: The coefficient describing rightward movement of the left corner of the mouth.
- **mouthRollLower**: The coefficient describing movement of the lower lip toward the inside of the mouth.
- **mouthRollUpper**: The coefficient describing movement of the upper lip toward the inside of the mouth.
- **mouthShrugLower**: The coefficient describing outward movement of the lower lip.
- **mouthShrugUpper**: The coefficient describing outward movement of the upper lip.
- **mouthPressLeft**: The coefficient describing upward compression of the lower lip on the left side.
- **mouthPressRight**: The coefficient describing upward compression of the lower lip on the right side.
- **mouthLowerDownLeft**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the lower lip on the left side.
- **mouthLowerDownRight**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the lower lip on the right side.
- **mouthUpperUpLeft**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the upper lip on the left side.
- **mouthUpperUpRight**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the upper lip on the right side.

## Eyebrows, Cheeks, and Nose

- **browDownLeft**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the outer portion of the left eyebrow.
- **browDownRight**: The coefficient describing downward movement of the outer portion of the right eyebrow.
- **browInnerUp**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the inner portion of both eyebrows.
- **browOuterUpLeft**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the outer portion of the left eyebrow.
- **browOuterUpRight**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the outer portion of the right eyebrow.
- **cheekPuff**: The coefficient describing outward movement of both cheeks.
- **cheekSquintLeft**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the cheek around and below the left eye.
- **cheekSquintRight**: The coefficient describing upward movement of the cheek around and below the right eye.
- **noseSneerLeft**: The coefficient describing a raising of the left side of the nose around the nostril.
- **noseSneerRight**: The coefficient describing a raising of the right side of the nose around the nostril.

## Tongue

- **tongueOut**: The coefficient describing extension of the tongue.

## Creating a Blend Shape Location

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a blend shape location.

## Using Blend Shapes

- **blendShapes**: A dictionary of named coefficients representing the detected facial expression in terms of the movement of specific facial features.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
